fr.sorbonne_u.cps.dht_mapreduce.interfaces.mapreduce

Interface MapReduceI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    MapReduceSyncI
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    MapReduceCI, ParallelMapReduceCI, ParallelMapReduceI

    public interface MapReduceI
extends MapReduceSyncI
    The interface MapReduceI defines the methods implementing the map and the reduce computations over the DHT.

    Description

    This interface is used as an implementation interface for components representing the nodes of the DHT and that provides a map/reduce facility over the entries of the DHT. The computation is done in two phases: first the map traverses the DHT nodes and then the reduce. To enable a parallelism between the map/reduce computations, an URI is attributed to each of them so that intermediate results can be stored, retrieved and cleared on nodes as the computations progress.

    This map/reduce facility assumes that the computations for the map and the reduce is fully commutative and associative. This will allow to explore more forms of parallelism in the implementation of the DHT. Also, the map, as usual, can be executed completely asynchronously i.e., when a node execute a call to map, it can forward the call to the next node and need not wait for a result from this next node. The reduce phase is not as simple. Therefore, this interface defines two distinct reduce methods, one that is called synchronously, returning its result to the caller with a usual return statement, and one that is called asynchronously but providing a last parameter giving the information to send the result back to the caller using an asynchronous computation pattern.

    Invariants

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Created on : 2024-06-04

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

      <R extends java.io.Serializable>
      void      		 map(java.lang.String computationURI, SelectorI selector, ProcessorI<R> processor)
      map the processor computation over the entries in the DHT that passes the selector test.
      <A extends java.io.Serializable,R,I extends MapReduceResultReceptionCI>
      void      		 reduce(java.lang.String computationURI, ReductorI<A,R> reductor, CombinatorI<A> combinator, A identityAcc, A currentAcc, fr.sorbonne_u.components.endpoints.EndPointI<I> caller)
      asynchronously reduce the results of type R from a previously executed map with URI computationURI using an accumulator of type A; reductor is the function that computes a new accumulator value from the previous one and a map result while combinator is the function that computes a new accumulator value from two previous accumulator values.

    • Method Detail

      • map

        <R extends java.io.Serializable> void map(java.lang.String computationURI,
                                          SelectorI selector,
                                          ProcessorI<R> processor)
                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        map the processor computation over the entries in the DHT that passes the selector test.

        Contract

         pre     computationURI != null && !computationURI.isEmpty()
 pre     selector != null
 pre     processor != null
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Type Parameters:
        R - type of the results of the map computation.
        Parameters:
        computationURI - URI of the computation, used to distinguish parallel maps over the same DHT.
        selector - a boolean function that selects the entries in the DHT that will be processed by the map.
        processor - a function implementing the processing to be mapped itself.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.

      • reduce

        <A extends java.io.Serializable,R,I extends MapReduceResultReceptionCI> void reduce(java.lang.String computationURI,
                                                                                    ReductorI<A,R> reductor,
                                                                                    CombinatorI<A> combinator,
                                                                                    A identityAcc,
                                                                                    A currentAcc,
                                                                                    fr.sorbonne_u.components.endpoints.EndPointI<I> caller)
                                                                             throws java.lang.Exception
        asynchronously reduce the results of type R from a previously executed map with URI computationURI using an accumulator of type A; reductor is the function that computes a new accumulator value from the previous one and a map result while combinator is the function that computes a new accumulator value from two previous accumulator values.

        Contract

         pre     computationURI != null && !computationURI.isEmpty()
 pre     reductor != null
 pre     combinator != null
 pre     callerNode != null
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Type Parameters:
        A - type of the accumulator.
        R - type of the map results.
        I - type of the result reception component interface.
        Parameters:
        computationURI - URI of the computation, used to distinguish parallel maps over the same DHT.
        reductor - function A x R -> A accumulating one map result.
        combinator - function A x A -> A combining two accumulators.
        identityAcc - the identity accumulator value i.e., reducing or combining any value v with this value returns v.
        currentAcc - the previously accumulated value.
        caller - an end point where to forward the final accumulator after all reductions.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.
